abstract: The speed with which the Securities and Exchange Commission identified and took action against alleged insider trading in Dow Jones stock this week was “a phenomenal achievement,” Harvey Pitt, the S.E.C.’s former chairman, declared in an interview with The Wall Street Journal’s Law Blog. Mr. Pitt, who served from 2001 to 2003, said that “in the old days, it took a while to figure out who knew what, when and where. I would say enforcement is alive and well.”
